item.title: Lahore bombing: Pakistan mourns as death toll rises
item.description: Grief mounts as three-day mourning period begins in Pakistan after attack targets Christian minority on Easter.

item.title: Somalia's forgotten soldiers
item.description: A growing sense of neglect among Somali soldiers as they are left to deal with loss and injuries on their own.

item.title: Turkey: No to terrorism, no to double standards
item.description: If you collaborate with a terror group for whatever reason, it will eventually harm you.

item.title: Taliban fires explosives at Afghan parliament compound
item.description: Members of Parliament say no one was hurt, contradicting Taliban spokesman who claimed the raid caused heavy casualties.

item.title: Scores killed in attack on park in Pakistan's Lahore
item.description: At least 70 people dead and more than 300 wounded as bomber kills mostly women and children in Pakistan's Lahore.

item.title: Bomb blast in Pakistan's Lahore
item.description: At least 70 people dead and more than 300 wounded as bomber kills mostly women and children in Pakistan's Lahore.

item.title: Pakistan's politicians also to blame for Lahore attack
item.description: The Pakistan Taliban may have lost the war, but it is being handed propaganda victories on a platter.

item.title: Israel backs out of spat with Brazil over Dani Dayan
item.description: Dani Dayan reassigned to serve as Israel's consul in New York after Brazil rejected him for his pro-settlement stance.

item.title: Iraqi children scavenge for a living
item.description: After fleeing from ISIL, dozens of young Iraqis spend their days searching through rubbish heaps for valuable scraps.

item.title: Opponents of Malaysian PM join hands to oust him
item.description: Politicians from across spectrum led by ex-PM Mahathir Mohammed call for Najib Razak's ousting over corruption scandal.

item.title: Saudi-led coalition announces Yemen prisoner swap
item.description: Nine Saudis were exchanged for 109 Yemeni nationals who were detained near Saudi border, state news agency says.

item.title: Egypt's devaluation woes
item.description: Hopes are that devaluation will resolve Egypt's dollar crisis, but the situation could spiral out of control.

item.title: Iraqi cleric Muqtada al-Sadr starts Green Zone sit-in
item.description: After weeks of rallies by his followers, influential cleric launches protest to demand sweeping changes by government.

item.title: Pakistan army called in to quell blasphemy law protest
item.description: Thousands protest in Islamabad against execution of Mumtaz Qadri, who murdered governor critical of blasphemy law.

item.title: Brussels attacks: Protesters and police clash at shrine
item.description: Riot police disperse right-wing protesters at a temporary shrine honouring victims of the Brussels suicide bombings.

item.title: Ireland marks 100th anniversary of Easter Rising
item.description: Thousands march in Ireland commemorating the 1916 revolt that led to its independence from Britain.

item.title: Refugees stuck in Idomeni: Questions but no answers
item.description: Thousands stuck at a makeshift camp across Greece-Macedonia border are clueless about what is going to happen next.

item.title: The dark prisoners: Inside the CIA's torture programme
item.description: Despite US admissions that it tortured people after 9/11, little has been heard from the victims themselves.

item.title: How impunity defines Israel and victimises Palestinians
item.description: The danger of impunity is the very foundation of most violent crimes against humanity.

item.title: France's labour reforms: Pro-business or pro-worker?
item.description: We take a look at France's high unemployment rate and explore who will benefit from the proposed labour law reforms.

item.title: UAE sentences 11 to life in jail over terror plots
item.description: The men are accused of raising funds and financial support to groups such as al-Nusra Front and ISIL.

item.title: Bernie Sanders beats Hillary Clinton in three states
item.description: Democratic candidate's supporters buoyed by wins in Alaska, Washington and Hawaii but rival still holds delegate lead.

item.title: Is La Nina set to follow El Nino?
item.description: Night follows day, summer follows spring: but does La Nina always follow El Nino?

item.title: Syrian army 'recaptures city of Palmyra from ISIL'
item.description: Government troops, backed by waves of Russian strikes, take ancient city in central Syria after days of intense battles.

item.title: Japan's opposition regroup to protect constitution
item.description: New Democratic Party wants to save Japan from one of 'deepest crises of democracy the nation has faced in 70 years'.
